    How to use this package

    Mauricio Vargas

    2019-06-08

    basic-usage.Rmd

    Basic trade example

    Package data

    I’ll use this demo dataset to illustrate the essential usage of the functions within this package:

    library(economiccomplexity)

world_trade_2017
    ## # A tibble: 233,432 x 3
##    reporter_iso product_code export_value_usd
##    <chr>        <chr>                   <dbl>
##  1 afg          3912                       NA
##  2 afg          0101                       NA
##  3 afg          0102                   387017
##  4 afg          0103                       NA
##  5 afg          0104                   213011
##  6 afg          0105                       NA
##  7 afg          0106                  1316346
##  8 afg          0201                       NA
##  9 afg          0202                       NA
## 10 afg          0203                       NA
## # … with 233,422 more rows

    Revealed comparative Advantage (RCA)

    You can obtain RCA with revealed_comparative_advantage():

    rca <- revealed_comparative_advantage(
  d = world_trade_2017, 
  c = "reporter_iso",
  p = "product_code", 
  v = "export_value_usd"
)

rca[1:5,1:5]
    ## 5 x 5 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
##     0101 0102 0103 0104 0105
## afg    .    .    .    1    .
## ago    .    .    .    .    .
## aia    .    .    .    .    .
## alb    .    .    .    .    .
## and    1    .    .    .    .

    And also you can obtain it in tabular version:

    rca_tbl <- revealed_comparative_advantage(
  d = world_trade_2017, 
  c = "reporter_iso",
  p = "product_code",
  v = "export_value_usd",
  tbl_output = T
)

rca_tbl
    ## # A tibble: 176,971 x 3
##    country product value
##    <chr>   <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 afg     0102        0
##  2 afg     0104        1
##  3 afg     0106        1
##  4 afg     0204        1
##  5 afg     0207        0
##  6 afg     0307        0
##  7 afg     0401        0
##  8 afg     0402        0
##  9 afg     0403        0
## 10 afg     0406        0
## # … with 176,961 more rows

    Another possibility, not used to build networks from bipartite relations, is to obtain RCA as a matrix or tibble without discretization:

    rca_decimal <- revealed_comparative_advantage(
  d = world_trade_2017,
  c = "reporter_iso",
  p = "product_code",
  v = "export_value_usd",
  tbl_output = F,
  discrete = F
)

rca_decimal[1:5,1:5]
    ## 5 x 5 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"
##         0101         0102 0103    0104 0105
## afg .        9.771810e-01    . 3.11597    .
## ago .        5.915342e-05    . .          .
## aia .        .               . .          .
## alb .        1.038204e-02    . .          .
## and 3.126295 .               . .          .
    rca_decimal_tbl <- revealed_comparative_advantage(
  d = world_trade_2017,
  c = "reporter_iso",
  p = "product_code",
  v = "export_value_usd",
  tbl_output = T,
  discrete = T
)

rca_decimal_tbl
    ## # A tibble: 176,971 x 3
##    country product value
##    <chr>   <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 afg     0102        0
##  2 afg     0104        1
##  3 afg     0106        1
##  4 afg     0204        1
##  5 afg     0207        0
##  6 afg     0307        0
##  7 afg     0401        0
##  8 afg     0402        0
##  9 afg     0403        0
## 10 afg     0406        0
## # … with 176,961 more rows

    Complexity Measures

    You can compute both Economic Complexity Index (ECI) and Product Complexity Index (PCI) by using complexity_measures(). The calculations methods are reflections, eigenvalues and fitness (default). See (Hausmann et al. 2014) and (Mariani et al. 2015) for the methodological details.

    complexity_measures_reflections <- complexity_measures(
  world_rca_2017, 
  method = "reflections", 
  tbl_output = T
)

complexity_measures_reflections$economic_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 224 x 2
##    country value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 jpn      2.27
##  2 che      2.20
##  3 deu      1.97
##  4 bvt      1.91
##  5 kor      1.82
##  6 cze      1.74
##  7 aut      1.73
##  8 sgp      1.71
##  9 swe      1.68
## 10 svn      1.66
## # … with 214 more rows
    complexity_measures_reflections$product_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 1,222 x 2
##    product value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 2812     2.68
##  2 8457     2.25
##  3 3705     2.20
##  4 9012     2.19
##  5 8420     2.17
##  6 8113     2.16
##  7 3818     2.00
##  8 9017     1.96
##  9 8475     1.95
## 10 2920     1.91
## # … with 1,212 more rows
    complexity_measures_eigenvalues <- complexity_measures(
  world_rca_2017,
  method = "eigenvalues",
  tbl_output = T
)

complexity_measures_eigenvalues$economic_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 224 x 2
##    country value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 jpn      2.28
##  2 che      2.20
##  3 deu      1.97
##  4 bvt      1.91
##  5 kor      1.82
##  6 cze      1.74
##  7 aut      1.73
##  8 sgp      1.72
##  9 swe      1.68
## 10 svn      1.66
## # … with 214 more rows
    complexity_measures_eigenvalues$product_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 1,222 x 2
##    product value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 2812     2.68
##  2 8457     2.25
##  3 3705     2.20
##  4 9012     2.19
##  5 8420     2.17
##  6 8113     2.16
##  7 3818     2.01
##  8 9017     1.96
##  9 8475     1.96
## 10 2920     1.91
## # … with 1,212 more rows
    complexity_measures_fitness <- complexity_measures(
  world_rca_2017,
  method = "fitness", 
  tbl_output = T
)

complexity_measures_fitness$economic_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 224 x 2
##    country value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 deu      4.83
##  2 chn      4.44
##  3 jpn      3.87
##  4 ita      3.77
##  5 usa      3.18
##  6 fra      3.17
##  7 esp      2.99
##  8 nld      2.63
##  9 bel      2.51
## 10 cze      2.44
## # … with 214 more rows
    complexity_measures_fitness$product_complexity_index
    ## # A tibble: 1,222 x 2
##    product value
##    <chr>   <dbl>
##  1 2812    13.7 
##  2 5005    10.4 
##  3 2913     7.22
##  4 8444     6.88
##  5 3702     6.37
##  6 9016     5.94
##  7 9012     5.61
##  8 7221     4.64
##  9 3818     4.22

## # … with 1,212 more rows

    Proximity

    # proximity <- proximity_matrices(d = world_rca_2017,
#   diversity = complexity_measures_2017$diversity,
#   ubiquity = complexity_measures_2017$ubiquity)
# 
# networks <- networks(proximity_matrices_2017$countries_proximity,
#   proximity_matrices_2017$products_proximity, tbl_output = T)

    Hausmann, Ricardo, César Hidalgo, Sebastián Bustos, Michele Coscia, Alexander Simoes, and Muhammed Yildirim. 2014. The Atlas of Economic Complexity: Mapping Paths to Prosperity. Mit Press.

    Mariani, Manuel, Alexandre Vidmer, Matsúš Medo, and Yi-Cheng Zhang. 2015. “Measuring Economic Complexity of Countries and Products: Which Metric to Use?” The European Physical Journal B 88 (11). Springer: 293.
